text: whoa hi I'm Melissa Clark and these
scary looking things are my celery roots
you've probably seen celery root at the
supermarket or at the farmers market and
you'd think I don't know what to do with
this thing
but celery roots are so versatile and so
delicious and they're actually pretty
easy to deal with first thing you need
to do is look at it if it looks really
dirty go ahead and give it a little
rinse and then Pat it dry next you want
to get rid of all of these little roots
now you're probably gonna end up slicing
off about a third of the celery root
that is okay don't try to get in there
and clean it up it's just not worth it
you need a big sharp knife and then just
trim around the sides depending upon how
thick the skin is and how deep the roots
go in the celery root you might want to
use your chef's knife to trim it or you
may want to use a paring knife or if
you're lucky and the skin is thin you
can get away with a vegetable peeler if
you see a little cranny filled with dirt
you just want to get in there with your
paring knife and dig it right out like a
potato so here you have it a perfectly
clean peel the celery root see not so
scary anymore
if you're not gonna use it immediately
it will discolor so if you want to keep
it nice and white just take half a lemon
and rub it all over the surface or you
can just drop it in a bowl of acidulated
water celery root is great raw the
French make it into a REM Malad which is
like a slaw with lots of mayonnaise and
mustard so good just shred it up in your
food processor and mix it into a little
salad or if you want to bring out the
sweeter side of a celery root you can
cook it you can boil it and then mash it
with potatoes for a mashed celery root
potato dish or you can roast it which is
my favorite way to roast celery root
what you want to do is cut it up into
small bite-sized pieces you need a big
knife for this and some strength
upper-body strength okay that's the hard
part now I'm just going to oil these up
put some salt and pepper on them toss it
together till they're coated and roast
them at 425 until they're golden and
tender and here we go
roasted celery root the sweeter side of
the scary beast
